DataElement.preferredName: Participant Consent Optional Blood Specimen For Research Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to a question that asks whether the participant provided permission for optional blood specimen(s) for systematic investigation in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Consent Optional Blood Specimen For Research
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to someone who takes part in an activity and giving permission to provide a part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis for systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:No Value Exists:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

Concepts.definition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A choice of Yes and No answer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the participant consent t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant consent to provide optional blood specimen(s) for research?
